name: トンバ！ ザ・ワイルドアドベンチャー
summary: Tomba! 2: The Evil Swine Return is a platform game developed by Whoopee Camp and published by Sony Computer Entertainment for the PlayStation. The game was released in Japan in October 1999 and worldwide in 2000, and re-released in Japan in September 2011, in Europe in November 2012, and in North America in November 2015. The game is a sequel to Tomba! and centers on the exploits of a pink-haired feral child named Tomba as he attempts to rescue his girlfriend Tabby from a race of anthropomorphic and antagonistic pigs. The game was received positively by critics, with particular praise going to the visuals and varied objective-based gameplay, with more mixed reception directed toward the audio. Whoopee Camp disbanded following the game's lackluster commercial performance.
